awd_abstract_narration: Research on collective modes and dynamical transport                       coefficients of strongly coupled plasmas using analytical                       techniques are carried forward.  In particular the Quasi                        Localized Charge Model developed during the last few years                      will be applied to the calculation of dielectric response                       tensors and collective mode structures for Coulomb liquids at                   strong coupling.  Applications include dense, hot plasmas,                      electron gas in metals, molten salts, liquid metals, two-                       dimensional electron liquids at the interface of dielectric                     materials, superlattices and binary ionic mixtures.  The non-                   perturbative approaches used in the current research allow                      computations where customary perturbation methods are                           inadequate.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
